page.title: 18PARISH COUNCIL,WIVELISCOMBE
page.content: We went to see Mr Jones,a parish councillor, to find out the concerns of this area. He told us that the parish councillor has the advantage of knowing the area, the people and their problems. One of the present concerns is the reduced car parking in the centre of Wiveliscombe since London House, in the Square, has been renovated,and the appearance of the whole Square enhanced. Local traders felt it was affecting trade. He felt that transport in the area was meagre and expensive; of course there have not been trains for many years.Younger families have moved out to Wellington, and elsewhere, for work and transport, while the number of older people is growing.What would be the future age balance in the community? Would it affect schools?
